result.execSummary:
The defendant Anna Hays was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anna Hays is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anna Hays was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant to return to Court every six months for progress review. Maintain full-time employment. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. No contact C.T. or P.S. Contact with D.M. will be determined by agent. Submit DNA sample.

Restitution to be determined. 

Restitution Order filed October 6, 2016.

timeConds.notes: Huber to include release for treatment, AODA and cognitive behavior therapy.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Mark Lawton
ADA Long discovery letter to Atty. Lawton

Called at 11:05 a.m., Defendant Anna Hays in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by victim's family: D.K., C.K., J.K., K.P.,  M.K. and J.K. ADA Long motioned the Court to agree with the sentencing agreement. Statement by defendant's mother. Defendant made statement. Atty. Lawton addressed the Court. Court withheld sentence, placed defendant on 7 years probation, conditions: 14 days jail. Huber to include release for treatment, AODA and cognitive behavior therapy. Return to Court every six months for progress review. $518 court costs. Maintain full-time employment. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. No contact C.T. or P.S. Contact with D.M. will be determined by agent. Restitution to be determined. Submit DNA sample.189 days jail credit.  Adjourned at 12:05 p.m.
from N.K.'s mother, C.K., J.K., J.K. and M.K.
Sentencing hearing at 04-12-2016 11:00 am
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton
Filed by ADA Crystal Long

Defendant Anna Hays in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel requested PSI.  Amended information was filed.  State motioned to orally amend Ct. 2 to add PTAC, and amend town of Newport to read Town of Lodi.  Reading waived.  Agreement was recited on the record.  With a plea to Ct. 2 State agrees to a withheld sentence.  Defendant will be placed on probation for 7 years.  Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs, submit DNA sample, restitution to be determined, AODA and comply, and conditional jail time.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed without prejudice, with the understanding that she is to testify truthfully at co defendants hearing.  If there is untruthful testimony, Ct. 1 will be recharged.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 2.  Court found guilty.  Ct. 1 dismissed without prejudice.  PSI ordered by court.  PSI must be completed within 45 days.  Sentencing will be held on 4-12-16 at 11:00 am.   11:20/11:35

Defendant Anna Hays in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.   20 days to for Motions to be filed.
